channel.title: Jarring!
channel.description:
Yo, I can't seem to jar my packaged client. I did set the manifest right, and even tryed tons of other. After i jarred the client, and tryed launching it, it didn't work! It's a PI Client.
Already tryed it launching the jar through a local html file, but it still does not work.
Help would be appreciated,
Kind regards, Sh0ck

item.title: Jarring!
item.dc:creator: @xXSh0ckXx xXSh0ckXx
item.description:
@xXSh0ckXx wrote:

[quote=“Ambokile, post:11, topic:538747”][quote author=xXSh0ckXx link=topic=657579.msg4399589#msg4399589 date=1390249798]

It’s fairly obvious what’s happening. The JAR is looking for “client.class”. You have “com/Client.class”.

Somehow the directory doesn’t really matter, i tryed tons of different ways, so the .bat can reach the file, i tryed /bin/com too, so it’s directory is where the classes are, but still doesn’t work. But the client class it located there
[/quote]
It’s not about the directory, it’s about the package that the class is located in. “client” does not exist, only “com.Client” does.[/quote]
Oh i get it! I’ll try to figure it out tomorrow!

Read full topic

item.title: Jarring!
item.dc:creator: @Ambokile Ambokile
item.description:
@Ambokile wrote:

[quote=“xXSh0ckXx, post:10, topic:538747”][quote author=Ambokile link=topic=657579.msg4399538#msg4399538 date=1390241341]
It’s fairly obvious what’s happening. The JAR is looking for “client.class”. You have “com/Client.class”.
[/quote]
Somehow the directory doesn’t really matter, i tryed tons of different ways, so the .bat can reach the file, i tryed /bin/com too, so it’s directory is where the classes are, but still doesn’t work. But the client class it located there[/quote]
It’s not about the directory, it’s about the package that the class is located in. “client” does not exist, only “com.Client” does.

Read full topic

item.title: Jarring!
item.dc:creator: @xXSh0ckXx xXSh0ckXx
item.description:
@xXSh0ckXx wrote:

[quote=“Ambokile, post:7, topic:538747”][quote author=xXSh0ckXx link=topic=657579.msg4398995#msg4398995 date=1390050793]

You should be able to get the error that is stopping the jar from loading. Please post it here.

How can the jar stop when it doesn’t even start?
[/quote]
Stop being pernickety, I’m trying to help you. Replace “stopping” with “preventing” in my previous post.

If you run it as a Web applet, you should be able to click “details”.[/quote]

ClassNotFoundException

client.class

I signed my client etc., i’ve heard about it, is it maybe because the security update of jre7u51? It tells me “Application blocked. click for more details.” and below there is something like “Your security-settings stopped the work of the application, because of self-signing.” (It’s translated from german to english lel) It kinda explains: The jar is signed, that’s why the application stopped :palm:. Now downloading an older version of java, so i can test out if it works. **EDIT:

I’m trying to run it through a .bat file, here is the source code:

@ECHO OFF
title Client
cd ./bin/com/ //this is the directory which contains all class files
java -Xmx1000M client 30 0 highmem members 32 //i chose client, because i have no gui class
pause

This error shows up:

Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: client (wrong name: c om/Client) at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass1(Native Method) at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass(Unknown Source) at java.security.SecureClassLoader.defineClass(Unknown Source) at java.net.URLClassLoader.defineClass(Unknown Source) at java.net.URLClassLoader.access$100(Unknown Source) at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(Unknown Source) at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(Unknown Source) at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method) at java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass(Unknown Source) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) at sun.misc.Launcher$AppClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) at sun.launcher.LauncherHelper.checkAndLoadMain(Unknown Source)

Anyone?

Read full topic

item.title: Jarring!
item.dc:creator: @Ambokile Ambokile
item.description:
@Ambokile wrote:

[quote=“xXSh0ckXx, post:6, topic:538747”][quote author=Ambokile link=topic=657579.msg4398971#msg4398971 date=1390039421]
You should be able to get the error that is stopping the jar from loading. Please post it here.
[/quote]
How can the jar stop when it doesn’t even start?[/quote]
Stop being pernickety, I’m trying to help you. Replace “stopping” with “preventing” in my previous post.

If you run it as a Web applet, you should be able to click “details”.

Read full topic

Not sure if i did tho, i did just set the directory to the compiled classes.
